item.text: Afterward David inquired of the Lord, “Should I go up to one of the cities of Judah?” The Lord told him, “Go up.” David asked, “Where should I go?” The Lord replied, “To Hebron.”

So <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="05927 08033">went up</st>, <st data-num="01571" class="">along with</st> his <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st>, <st data-num="0293" class="">Ahinoam</st> the <st data-num="03159" class="">Jezreelite</st> and <st data-num="026" class="">Abigail</st>, formerly the <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> of <st data-num="05037" class="">Nabal</st> the <st data-num="03761" class="">Carmelite</st>.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> also <st data-num="05927" class="">brought</st> along the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> him, <st data-num="0376" class="">each</st> with his <st data-num="01004" class="">family</st>. They <st data-num="03427" class="">settled</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="02275" class="">Hebron</st>.

The men of Judah came and there they anointed David as king over the people of Judah.

David was told, “The people of Jabesh Gilead are the ones who buried Saul.”
So David sent messengers to the people of Jabesh Gilead and told them, “May you be blessed by the Lord because you have shown this kindness to your lord Saul by burying him.
Now may the Lord show you true kindness! I also will reward you, because you have done this deed.
Now be courageous and prove to be valiant warriors, for your lord Saul is dead. The people of Judah have anointed me as king over them.”
Now Abner son of Ner, the general in command of Saul’s army, had taken Saul’s son Ish Bosheth and had brought him to Mahanaim.

He <st data-num="04427" class="">appointed</st> him <st data-num="04427" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">over</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>, the <st data-num="01651" class="">Geshurites</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03157" class="">Jezreel</st>, <st data-num="05921 0669">Ephraim</st>, <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.

<st data-num="0378" class="">Ish Bosheth</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> was <st data-num="0705" class="">forty</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> when he began to <st data-num="04427" class="">rule</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>. He <st data-num="04427" class="">ruled</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>. <st data-num="0389" class="">However</st>, the <st data-num="01004" class="">people</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="01961 0310">followed</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>.
David was king in Hebron over the people of Judah for seven-and-a-half years.
Then Abner son of Ner and the servants of Ish Bosheth son of Saul went out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.

<st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06870" class="">Zeruiah</st> and the <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> of <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> also <st data-num="03318" class="">went out</st> and <st data-num="06298 03162">confronted</st> them <st data-num="05921" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="01295" class="">pool</st> of <st data-num="01391" class="">Gibeon</st>. <st data-num="0428" class="">One group</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">stationed</st> themselves <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">one side of</st> the <st data-num="01295" class="">pool</st>, and the <st data-num="0428" class="">other group</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="02088" class="">other side of</st> the <st data-num="01295" class="">pool</st>.
Abner said to Joab, “Let the soldiers get up and fight before us.” Joab said, “So be it!”
So they got up and crossed over by number: 12 belonging to Benjamin and to Ish Bosheth son of Saul, and 12 from the servants of David.
As they grappled with one another, each one stabbed his opponent with his sword and they fell dead together. So that place is called the Field of Flints; it is in Gibeon.
Now the battle was very severe that day; Abner and the men of Israel were overcome by David’s soldiers.

The <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of <st data-num="06870" class="">Zeruiah</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>—<st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st>, <st data-num="052" class="">Abishai</st>, and <st data-num="06214" class="">Asahel</st>. (Now <st data-num="06214" class="">Asahel</st> was as <st data-num="07031" class="">quick</st> on his <st data-num="07272" class="">feet</st> as <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="06643 0834">gazelles</st> in the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st>.)
Asahel chased Abner, without turning to the right or to the left as he followed Abner.
Then Abner turned and asked, “Is that you, Asahel?” He replied, “Yes it is!”

<st data-num="074" class="">Abner</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “<st data-num="05186" class="">Turn aside</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> your <st data-num="03225" class="">right</st> <st data-num="0176" class="">or</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> your <st data-num="08040" class="">left</st>. <st data-num="0270" class="">Capture</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="05288" class="">soldiers</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> his <st data-num="02488" class="">equipment</st> for yourself!” But <st data-num="06214" class="">Asahel</st> was <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="014" class="">willing</st> to <st data-num="05493" class="">turn aside</st> from <st data-num="0310" class="">following</st> him.

So <st data-num="074" class="">Abner</st> <st data-num="03254 0559">spoke</st> <st data-num="05750" class="">again</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="06214" class="">Asahel</st>, “<st data-num="05493" class="">Turn aside</st> from <st data-num="0310" class="">following</st> me! I <st data-num="04100" class="">do not want to</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">strike</st> you to the <st data-num="0776" class="">ground</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0349" class="">How</st> then could I <st data-num="05375" class="">show</st><n id="2" /> my <st data-num="06440" class="">face</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">in the presence of</st> <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> your <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st>?”

But Asahel refused to turn aside. So Abner struck him in the abdomen with the back end of his spear. The spear came out his back; Asahel collapsed on the spot and died there right before Abner. Everyone who came to the place where Asahel fell dead paused in respect.
So Joab and Abishai chased Abner. At sunset they came to the hill of Ammah near Giah on the way to the wilderness of Gibeon.
The Benjaminites formed their ranks behind Abner and were like a single army, standing at the top of a certain hill.
Then Abner called out to Joab, “Must the sword devour forever? Don’t you realize that this will turn bitter in the end? When will you tell the people to turn aside from pursuing their brothers?”

<st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “As surely as <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">lives</st>, <st data-num="03588 03884">if</st> you had <st data-num="03588 03884">not</st> <st data-num="01696" class="">said</st> this, <st data-num="03588 0227">it would have been</st> <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st> before the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> would have <st data-num="05927" class="">abandoned</st> <st data-num="0376 0310">pursuit</st><n id="1" /> of their <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st>.”

Then <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> <st data-num="08628" class="">blew</st> the <st data-num="07782" class="">ram’s horn</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">stopped in their tracks</st>.<n id="1" /> They <st data-num="03808 05750">stopped</st> <st data-num="07291 0310">chasing</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> and <st data-num="03808 03254 05750">ceased</st> <st data-num="03898" class="">fighting</st>.<n id="2" />
Abner and his men went through the rift valley all that night. They crossed the Jordan River and went through the whole region of Bitron and came to Mahanaim.
Now Joab returned from chasing Abner and assembled all the people. Nineteen of David’s soldiers were missing, in addition to Asahel.

But <st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">soldiers</st> had <st data-num="05221" class="">slaughtered</st> the <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjaminites</st> and <st data-num="074" class="">Abner’s</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st>—in all, <st data-num="07969 03967 08346">360</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> had <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>!

They <st data-num="05375" class="">took</st> <st data-num="06214" class="">Asahel’s</st> body and <st data-num="06912" class="">buried</st> him in his <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> <st data-num="06913 0834">tomb</st> at <st data-num="01035" class="">Bethlehem</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> and his <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> then <st data-num="01980" class="">traveled</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> that <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st> and reached <st data-num="02275" class="">Hebron</st> by <st data-num="0215" class="">dawn</st>.
